content.question: Which of the following statements about the bonds in the reactants and products is most accurate?

choices.label: The sum of the bond enthalpies of the bonds in the reactant is greater than the sum of the bond enthalpies of the bonds in the products.
The sum of the bond enthalpies of the bonds in the reactant is less than the sum of the bond enthalpies of the bonds in the products.
The length of the bond between carbon and oxygen in CH3OH is shorter than the length of the bond between carbon and oxygen in CO.
All of the bonds in the reactant and products are polar.

content.answer: The sum of the bond enthalpies of the bonds in the reactant is greater than the sum of the bond enthalpies of the bonds in the products.

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
